title: Misfits, be proud of how much you achieved
body: Seriously, that team did things no one though possible, they made SKT work for the win. To me, they were a top notch EU team. Its time to go home, heads up, proud if their accomplishments and be ready for next year.

replies.body:
It's still pretty sad. 
If only their jungler smited the elder dragon, they would have won the game.

> [{quoted}](name=JungleTaliyahWTF,realm=EUW,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=wAnTktIh,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-10-20T12:58:49.506+0000)
>
> It's still pretty sad. 
> If only their jungler smited the elder dragon, they would have won the game.

I saw the tears in a couple of their eyes. I felt sorry for them, but Blank snagged it and thats all she wrote. Still as an NA player and not really a fan of any team. Misfits really showed how good their are despite their loss and a few mistakes.
After rewatching it, it seems like they smited at the exact same frame. It instantly goes down from 1067 HP, with both smites on CD after that.
Yeah, that's why I'm so mad. That smite, that fking 0.01 second cost them the whole game because this is how this game is designed, with paper turrets
lul you have been bronze elo for 6 years and thausands of matches how can you talk about this game being easy
Never said in any comment that the game is easy ...

> [{quoted}](name=JungleTaliyahWTF,realm=EUW,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=wAnTktIh,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-10-20T12:58:49.506+0000)

If only their jungler could land sej ult

> [{quoted}](name=GripaAviara,realm=EUNE,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=wAnTktIh,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-10-20T13:02:22.489+0000)
>
> 

If you're gonna uninstall the game like your other thread said, do it and go. Don't come in here and be rude man.

Well let's see:

1. Challenger to Worlds in a year. 2nd seed at that. 

2. Expected to be knocked out of Groups with maybe a hiccup of a fight or two. Reality they held their own and went beyond that.

3. Taking a SKT expected to have turned on come playoffs to the full 5 playing even with or an advantage in the majority of the games. For a Western team - given Western team reputations not named Fnatic - that's quite a big deal for an upstart team. 

At least they didn't go home 0-6 and Total Losers like most thought. But if results is all that matters then that makes your very blind to the road they had to get here. And that's what the praise is for.
Actually I would think it more the inhib siege in Game 4 but what am I to expect of someone who's just basing the pessimism off of the last thing seen of an entire year's journey.
Hes hard stuck silver doesn't understand basic League concepts yet. I wouldn't put it past him

Meh it aint about his skill, it's his personality. He's a hardcore sore loser. A guy who unless the team wins will throw a fit. He's probably pending leaving League because he's losing so much, and he blames the game for it, not his inability to learn.

> [{quoted}](name=LitAF,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=wAnTktIh,comment-id=0001000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2017-10-20T16:42:54.827+0000)
>
> Hes hard stuck silver doesn't understand basic League concepts yet. I wouldn't put it past him

He's been playing for so long though.

I know you mentioned the fact that they went from Challenger to Worlds in a year... but lets highlight that fact.  They came from challenger, took 2nd seed, made it through groups when people expected them to get booted out there, and then took SKT to game point with 2 games where they set the pace of the game with all their vision control around Baron AND their readiness to jump right off of Baron to take down any SKT members that got too close too fast.  Faker even fell during at least one of these, and used everything to try to escape.  They had Faker - the guy everyone claims to be the best player in the world (I'm not saying he isn't, just think saying that makes him seem like more than he is sometimes.  Even he makes mistakes after all) - looking tilted at many points.

> [{quoted}](name=GripaAviara,realm=EUNE,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=wAnTktIh,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2017-10-20T13:19:49.352+0000)

more than you probably will accomplish in your life time. {{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}}

> [{quoted}](name=GripaAviara,realm=EUNE,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=wAnTktIh,comment-id=00010000000000020000,timestamp=2017-10-20T15:15:01.301+0000)

They made it to world championship of league of legends a very popular video game. You will probably die a blue collar working class guy like the rest of us who hates their job and they are making money doing something they love. I'd say they have accomplished something.

You've also played 900 ranked games this season and are hard stuck silver 3 which is why you are so salty lol!
I play for fun not for climb, a concept your mind can't understand.

> [{quoted}](name=GripaAviara,realm=EUNE,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=wAnTktIh,comment-id=0001000000000002000000000000,timestamp=2017-10-20T15:42:45.122+0000)

I play for fun and I climb, a concept your mind can't understand.
I don't see you doing much climbing. Call me when you hit diamond.

> [{quoted}](name=GripaAviara,realm=EUNE,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=wAnTktIh,comment-id=000100000000000200000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-10-20T15:45:45.162+0000)
>
> I don't see you doing much climbing. Call me when you hit diamond.

top 2% vs top 40 %, hit gold you fucking pleb lol.
It's funny how I just have a different opinion, but you want me to silence me forever for my different opinion. And you call yourself I bet a civilised person from a democratic country
It's funny how you deleted your past comments and are now playing victim OMEGALUL

I'm not playing the victim. I deleted them because they already got -40 downvotes and don't want to get anymore free hate, direct attacks, comments about my ELO which i don't see why is that relevant to the discussion? (can't watch worlds and have an opinion unless I'm diamond?) and comments that are a graceful way to saying I should *delete* myself from this world (which btw if you say ingame you get banned ... funny no?). They are also available in case you didn't realise in other persons quotes, so if you think i deleted them just for playing the victim, gj.

I never directly attacked someone in them (except Riot), I just stated, albeit not in the most graceful way since I was not feeling that great yesterday, that Misfits, while playing honourable should not be congratulated for failure. Almost winning a game should not bring them eulogy even if is against titans like SKT. They lost making mistakes and is up to them to show the world they can improve and be the champions they have the potential to be. They even stated they want to win this, which it really made me root for them. And if a team doesn't come to worlds with that mentality ... I don't think that team should be at worlds.  

But suit yourself whatever if it makes you feel better

This dude actually got the mods to remove my comment

https://i.imgur.com/t1ikMSF.gif?noredirect

How many western teams get to say that they took the 3 time world champions to game 5, and nearly beat them in the end?

No one even expected Misfits to make it out of groups. Yet, here they are, just barely being able to topple the best team League of Legends has ever known.

Yes, they don't go home with a trophy, but everyone will remember them for defying all expectations.

Uh....no, they won't.

Yes, they'll have the title of "the team that *nearly* beat SKT", but at this point, with Korea's dominance over this game, that is the absolute best title a western team can have.

People will remember this match. Just watch.
Theres a difference between leaving groups and leaving finals. Yes they lose the championship, bit it's kind of impossible to win if there's SKT.

While i see where you can be coming from, after all, second place is first loser, there is one key part of the equation you seem to be missing. When a team like SKT, a team so dominant, nearly ensured first place, people don't remember SKT's actual matches, just that they won. However, whenever they even remotely get close to losing, when they suddenly don't seem dominant, its a lot more memorable than a victory. It's akin to a full blown revolution in history. Not all of the ones we learn work, but we remember them, because they almost shattered beliefs and a way of life, akin to our belief that SKT cant really lose because of how good they are. That's why it matters so much even as a loss, because it proved SKT aren't just overlords able to crush any team that isn't korean, and showed that western teams can actually catch up.

I'll be honest. I don't watch the tournament play. I don't have a particular interest in it.

HOWEVER.... I see so many horribly abrasive posters here. I'm not particularly a verbal saint myself, and lose myself in the heat of the moment, but this is an entirely different level of toxic I'm seeing.

I know some people may feel that tournaments may not be worth their salt and only the best team deserves praise, but that's simply not fair or true to other competitors.

These players treat the game they love the same as someone would treat football (either one) or Basketball, or the Olympics: It is a finite chance to define themselves within a realm of fans and peers. If any of you have ever played a competitive sport, did you appreciate the coach or fans who criticized and yelled and screamed at you and focused on a mistake, or did you appreciate the coach or fans who observed you for the purpose of "fun?" 

There's only one slot in a winning circle. But that doesn't mean that people who get close should not be praised as well. That's called good sportsmanship.

Amen.

The only other time SKT has been pushed to their limit has been in finals. I don't think they've ever needed to work this hard in Quarters.

Misfits fricken showed up, and brought the fight to SKT. Not many western teams are capable of saying that.

And here I was proud as fuck when G2 won a single game vs SKT in MSI finals, while getting crushed in the other 3 games. I was like "1 game is a win" and I hoped that MSF could do the same. But they really exceded what I could dream of. 4 out of 5 games were under their control. If it wasn't for SKT's precise lategame performances (and honestly some luck), MSF would've won game 4 or 5. They're still a rookie team. They haven't had as much time to really synergize as well as SKT and make these difficult chess moves in the lategame as consistently. But they pulled off a check mate twice and nearly two more times. If this team stays together, I have high hopes for them next year.
Legends Never DIe

Its not really a congrats for being a loser. Im not giving them a golden sticker and a participation trophy. What I am saying is that despite their loss and their mistakes that cost them a game, they should understand that they have shown that they are worlds material.

They need more practice, they need more training. But they are on a path to being a dangerous team to play against. 

And hopefully you feel better.

Well i'd be less sad if they got 3-0'd tbh , making it from challenger series to worlds and then losing to SKT is o but 3-2 , when they could win both 4th and 5th game , i wouldnt say easily but they were in the lead and in a position to make it , i folow this team since challenger series even tho their roster was a bit different and the thing is today SKT was beatable , and thats why its sad , cause now we need to wait a whole new year to see MSF on the world stage again , but right now i jsut want to see them against teams like RNG , SSG to show what more they can do , maybe next yeare they wont adapt to the meta very well , not having a successful training while SKT would perform at their top top level so even tho they become much better , a young team with so much potential , well this year they had a real chance who knows if they'll even have the chance to try it next year thats why im sad otherwise i wouldnt tbh , i was liking this team before this series right now im absolutely fanboying them tbh .
Did PowerOfEvil "clap" Faker? Or did they win through other lanes?

I can't stand this sentiment. Yeah, I am as shocked as ne one that misfits did something pretty incredible, but they should've won game five and that call to hit the drag was a wrong call. also, varus pick and sivir picks are horrible unless you dont want to win.
Typical western nonsense. Acting like you achieved something when the reality is that they lost, is just cringe. Stop with the "everyone is a winner" thing.

> [{quoted}](name=Sun Zero,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=wAnTktIh,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2017-10-21T06:13:54.871+0000)
>
> Typical western nonsense. Acting like you achieved something when the reality is that they lost, is just cringe. Stop with the "everyone is a winner" thing.

Your life must really suck if all you can be is negative.

This isnt an "everyone is a winner" thread. They lost, no ones denying that. Its a thread that is giving them their dues for putting up a fight against Skt.
